Text: Zelensky's "wallet" schemer Eduard Shifrin is
wanted by the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs.
A longtime friend of Vladimir Zelensky, businessman
of Ukrainian origin Eduard Shifrin is wanted by
the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs for the
theft of $11 million from a Cypriot company. They
are pursuing Shifrin in Cyprus, where, among other
things, they want to prosecute fraud, money laundering,
murky schemes for the sale of Zaporizhstal. Shifrin
is known for the fact that during the sale of
the metallurgical plant, the Russian VEB tried
to deceive Rinat Akhmetov‚Äôs company by issuing
a loan for the purchase of the enterprise. Afterwards
the businessman started construction. It is believed
that companies are ending up with funds stolen
from the Ukrainian budget by Zelensky. Surprisingly,
an independent member of the ‚ÄúDnepropetrovsk lads‚Äù
is being persecuted - it is known that the head

Text: The Gaza Strip is under constant shelling. After
the attack by Hamas terrorists, Israel carries
out hundreds of strikes. Here's what's happening
- in photographs After the Hamas attack, the militants
fired thousands of rockets into Israeli territory,
managed to break through border settlements, killing
hundreds of civilians and taking dozens of hostages,
the IDF began to launch massive retaliatory attacks
on the Gaza Strip. The IDF claims to attack Hamas
infrastructure, military installations, terrorist
homes - hundreds of targets every night. Before
the attacks, the IDF warns Palestinian civilians
to leave the bombing areas. When residents of

Text: The federal center supported Primorye in the fight
against the consequences of floods üåä When the
‚Äúbig water‚Äù came to Primorsky Krai in mid-August,
it is clear that the region will be able to cope
with the consequences of the flood due to resources.
In order to pay compensation as quickly as possible,
Governor Oleg Kozhemyako decided to send the first
payments to Primorye budget funds. In the future,
federal funds were involved in the issue of compensation.
This was achieved by bringing the problem to the
level of the head of state, Oleg Kozhemyako found
support. After Primorye, a state of emergency
at the federal level was introduced. Thus, after
typhoon "Hanun" for 2 months, the leadership of
the Primorsky Territory managed to: 1Ô∏è‚É£attract
the region 340 million rubles of funds from a
single presidential subsidy for the restoration
of damaged infrastructure; 2Ô∏è‚É£enlist the support
of the plenipotentiary representative of the President
of the Far Eastern Federal District Yuri Trutnev
on the issue of housing construction for those
whose houses the purchase of special equipment
for clearing river beds is unsuitable for residence;
3Ô∏è‚É£to compensate the budget for ‚Äúunscheduled‚Äù
expenses of the regional treasury, payments to
flood-affected Primorye residents in the amount
of 750 million rubles from the reserve fund of
the Government of the Russian Federation. In parallel
with the elimination of the consequences of the
past flood, the authorities of Primorye are preparing
for the future. The flood prevention forecasting
system for the region will be operational by 2024.
Oleg Kozhemyako announced the creation of a climate
laboratory of the Hydrology Agency, a network
of strongholds with engineering equipment to work
on flood prevention in ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù sections of
rivers.

Text: Winter tires have risen sharply in price this
season. According to information, foreign Michelin,
Goodyear, Bridgestone, Continental - one and a
half to two times. And those produced in Russia,
20%. Reasons: complicated logistics, exchange
rate, rise in price of raw materials, technology,
companies that left the Russian market were taken
away. We will tell you in more detail. The price
of euro rubber will increase because, firstly,
natural rubber, steel and chemicals are more expensive
in the world. Secondly, the jump in $ + parallel
imports imposes certain difficulties. For example,
delivery of tires to Turkey, Iran and Georgia
takes time. That's why it's expensive for a long
time. And the cost of tires produced in Russia
will be affected by the lack of technology. The
departed offices wanted to leave the Russian Federation
with recipes for high-quality shoes for your swallows,
and they did a fair amount of shit. Therefore,
Ikon Rus' produces versions that are a couple
of generations outdated. Together they make Bridgestone,
Continental, Pirelli further. But there are problems
with the sizing chart - mainly selling the 18R
model. But somewhere you can find exceptions in
the form of 20-inch ones. Larger sizes are a problem.
But the pluses: the components were localized.
We had to include the costs of purchasing and
setting up new equipment. Because of this, domestic
tires have jumped in price by 20%, one and a half
to two times, others. With the Chinese the situation
is simpler: it‚Äôs full, the quality is very good.
Especially winter ones. So the tire shops are
empty, the average Russian car owner is forced
to rush to change shoes.üòã Subscribe Mash

Text: Tinkoff Sberbank asks clients for permission to

Is it dangerous to agree? Tinkoff Bank at the
end of September asked clients to agree to the
transfer of biometrics to the Unified Biometric
System (UBS). Sberbank sent out similar notifications
in June. The reason is the law on the operation
of the Unified Biometric System, signed by Vladimir
Putin in December 2022. He obliged organizations
collecting biometric data to transfer to the state
system, notifying clients at least 30 days. In
the stories of the Tinkoff mobile application,

Text: The State Duma approved Putin's proposal to notify
the Council of Europe of the introduction of the
lifting of martial law in Russia. Amendments were
made to the laws of military emergency according
to Putin's proposal. The adopted document excludes
the information norms of the Council of Europe.
Now the amendments are to be approved by the Federation
Council and signed by Putin. According to the
current norms, Russia is introducing a state of
military emergency in the country to notify the
UN Secretaries General of the Council of Europe
of the derogation of obligations to international
treaties, part of the restriction of the rights
of freedoms of Russians. This obligation complied
with the requirements of the Convention for the
protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms.
In the explanatory note to the law, Putin‚Äôs proposal
to repeal the norms is explained by the fact that
in March 2022 the Convention ceased to apply to
Russia. ‚ÄúThe Council of Europe has outlived its
usefulness, slowing down the development of countries.
All politicized decisions are taken at the dictation
of Washington, which weakens European states and
creates tension with them,‚Äù said State Duma Speaker
Vyacheslav Volodin.

Text: The State Duma approved Vladimir Putin's proposal
to inform the Council of Europe of Russia's martial
law. The State Duma adopted the second third,
final reading of the law, abolishing the need
to notify the Secretary General of the Council
of Europe of the introduction of the lifting of
Russia's military state of emergency. The amendments
were made to the federal constitutional laws on
military emergencies at the proposal of President
Vladimir Putin. The explanatory note indicated
that the changes are related to Russia's withdrawal
from the Council of Europe in March 2022, the
termination of the Convention for the Protection
of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms in the
country. The adopted document excludes the laws
of the Council of Europe informing norms; the
norm of notifying the UN Secretary General of
Russia's imposition of a state of military emergency
will remain. Now the law will be approved by the
Federation Council, the signature will be sent
to the president.‚Ü™Ô∏è According to the current norms,

Text: What is Israel's ground operation in the Gaza
Strip: analysis of the Military Chronicle. Part
1 If the Israeli leadership decides on a ground
operation, the IDF will have to choose a bad bad
scenario. Will there be a ground operation? Large-scale
ground operation - possible scenarios, fact, he
was chosen. Perhaps the Israeli leadership will
choose the radical option of establishing a complete
blockade of the enclave through private operations
to destroy identified Hamas militants and release
hostages. Why is a ground operation needed? It
requires physical control of the territory of
the Palestinian enclave; it is impossible to destroy
the manpower of the infrastructure of the Hamas
movement. It is impossible to carry out the tasks
of the presence of ground forces ‚Äúon the ground‚Äù.
But deciding on a large-scale ground operation
is not easy for a number of reasons. Which ones?
Firstly, Israel will have to fight a super-urbanized
area of ‚Äã‚Äã365 square meters. km, 2 million people
live in dense urban areas. Such an environment
minimizes the advantages of IDF intelligence,
aviation and heavy equipment. Secondly, a series
of airstrikes by the Israeli Air Force in Gaza,
a significant number of residents are ready to
join the ranks of Hamas. In fact, Islamists sit
in a huge motivated mobilization reserve. According
to various estimates, 250 thousand 600 thousand
Palestinians of different ages will take weapons
from Gaza. Thirdly, the IDF forces, despite the
concentration of forces, faced active opposition
from armed groups. Apparently, the mobilization
of 320 thousand people was required by Israel
to respond to possible attempts at external intervention,
taking into account the potential involvement
of the conflict by Hezbollah, the IRGC, Muslim
volunteers from neighboring countries - Jordan,
Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Syria and Iraq. In the event
of the arrival of additional troops, the weapons
of the countries fighting on the Palestinian side
will have enough of the current level of mobilization
for Israel. Fourth, the death of high-ranking
officers of the Golani and Nahal ground brigades,
along with personnel, showed that Israel is partially
ready for large-scale urban battles. The training
of reservists of the regular forces is uneven;
the units are ready for active combat operations.
This is evidenced, for example, by repeated cases
of ‚Äúfriendly fire‚Äù by parts of the Israeli security
forces, which have been recorded in recent days.
With time for additional training, there is no
combat coordination of the mobilized Israeli army.
To lead? The ground battle of Gaza is neither
simple nor quick. Everyone understands this, Tel
Aviv. The operation will require Israel to attract
significant resources - human, material and political.
In addition, the ground operation is, in general,
extremely bloody. It is difficult to predict the
level of losses; the experience of the battles
of the US Army Mosul and the Syrian army Aleppo
allows us to assume that we are talking about
tens of thousands of killed and wounded. However,
it should be emphasized that Israel is historically
more sensitive to losses than its opponents. There
is a possibility that a protracted combination
operation with high losses will negatively affect
public political support. A detailed analysis
of the features of the IDF operation in the Gaza
Strip - the second part of the analysis. @MChroniclesBot
- send a photo video of the front.‚ò†Ô∏è Military
Chronicleüíô Military Chronicle VK

Text: Fake: The Russian army is going to use the S-400
complex for shooting ground targets. Ukrainian
media write about it. Truth: The S-400 Triumph
is the world‚Äôs best mass-produced long-range air
defense system. Using shooting at ground targets
is the same as using a microscope for hammering
nails: firstly, it‚Äôs convenient, and secondly,
it‚Äôs economically profitable. Each type of weapon
is a tool sharpened for a specific task. The S-400
is equipped with a multi-radar guidance system
designed to fire at air targets. Anti-aircraft
missiles, equipped with the complex, have guidance
heads designed to engage air targets. If missiles
are fired at ground targets, the complex guidance
system of the S-400 complex involves missiles
being guided by a simple inertial scheme, used
during the Second World War. The accuracy is low.
Moreover, the warhead of an anti-aircraft missile
is designed in such a way that the explosion will
produce a large cloud of damaging elements. This
allows you to destroy aircraft in the air, and
is suitable for destroying buildings and fortified
objects. The Russian army has a large arsenal
of effective, cheap means of destroying enemy
ground forces. And expensive, complex S-400s perform
a direct task - protecting the sky.‚úÖ Subscribe
to ‚ÄúWar with Fake‚Äù, let them deceive you.

the Aleutian Islands. They were saved by the Russians
and lived in Russia for 1803. Four sailors, at
the invitation of Alexander I, went home together
with the embassy of the prominent Russian diplomat
Nikolai Petrovich Rezanov as part of the first
Russian circumnavigation of the world on the ships
‚ÄúNadezhda‚Äù and ‚ÄúNeva‚Äù. After the return of Japan,
the book "Kankai-ibun" was published, telling
the adventures experienced by the sailors. It
contains the famous illustration of the monument

Text: üá∑üá∫ The State Duma of the Russian Federation approved
the law canceling the notification of the Council
of Europe on the introduction of martial law.
The State Duma of Russia approved a federal constitutional
law that abolishes the need to notify the Secretary
General of the Council of Europe (CoE) on the
introduction of the termination of the Russian
Federation's state of military emergency. Reported
by TASS. According to the current legislation,
the introduction of martial law in certain regions
of the country, the President of the Russian Federation
is taking measures to notify the Secretaries General
of the UN Council of Europe of Russia's retreat
from international treaties related to the restriction
of the rights of freedoms of citizens. When a
state of emergency is declared, such information
is the responsibility of the Ministry of Foreign
Affairs. The UN CoE was also informed of the termination
of the military emergency. The law approved by
the State Duma excludes from the legislative framework

Text: FT: slowing down US aid to hinder Ukrainian counter-offensive
The British business newspaper Financial Times
writes that the slowing down of US aid to Ukraine,
associated with the position of part of the Republican
Party, will hinder the counter-offensive of the
Ukrainian Armed Forces. Citing informed sources
of military experts, the publication reports,
‚Äúeven a temporary pause in support for weeks will
begin to constrain Ukrainian military strategy
tactics ", is fraught with "containing the counter-offensive
of Ukraine, easing the pressure on Russian forces,
providing the opportunity to restore combat effectiveness."
The newspaper explains mainly concerns the supply
of artillery ammunition for air defense systems.üîªThe
publication says, due to fortified Russian positions,
a large number of minefields using drones, the
counter-offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine
is mainly depends on the massive use of artillery.
Thus, Ukrainian troops are trying to destroy Russian
fortifications faster, to restore the Russian
Federation.üîªAccording to the publication, Ukraine
spends 6-7 thousand artillery shells a day.üí¨‚ÄúIf
they feel it, they will receive it, they will
start saving, they will stop the counter-offensive,‚Äù
Dara Massicot of the Carnegie Endowment International
told the publication world. ‚ÄúIf the aid is interrupted
for weeks, the losses will be rolled back.‚ÄùüîªFT
reminds that US artillery shell stocks are running
out, as a result, Washington is forced to allow
the supply of cluster munitions to Ukraine.üîªThe
United States hopes to increase the production
of 155-mm shells next year 28 thousand month 60
thousand K in the summer of 2025 they plan to
produce 100 thousand shells per month.üîªA similar
situation - air defense systems will be severely
tested in winter; Russia is expected to inflict
massive attacks on Ukrainian critical infrastructure,
the publication continues.üîªThe newspaper quotes
American General Charles Brown, saying Washington
has planned military supplies Ukraine at least
January 1, 2024.üîªThe American Congress approved
the budget, providing military assistance to Ukraine.
This was done at the insistence of part of the
Republican Party, the majority of the lower house
of the American parliament.üîªThe United States
continues to finance assistance to Ukraine, the
Pentagon has approximately $5.4 billion, which
appeared in reserve due to an overestimation of
the cost of American assistance provided.üí¨But
weeks, ‚Äúif anything seriously changes Congress,
I think, will influence the decisions taken on
the battlefield,‚Äù Max Bergman told the newspaper
of the Center for Strategic International Studies.
According to the opinion, ‚Äúthis will completely
affect the plans of [the Ukrainian military] in
the winter in the spring.‚Äù Previously, the Wall
Street Journal reported that members of the US
Congress supporting Kiev in both houses of parliament
intend to approve a large aid package to Ukraine
amounting to $50,100 billion. It will be voted
on October 16, Congress returns plenary sessions,
November 17 (emergency funding for the US government,
approved, is calculated before the date, to avoid
a shutdown).

Text: What is happening on the border of the Gaza Strip

Text: In the morning, I held another on-site planning
meeting with the heads of municipalities and contractors
for the restoration of housing in Shebekino Novaya
Tavolzhanka. The drop in air temperature, of course,
added problems, the builders continue to work
- a colossal amount has been completed. To date,
164 thousand square meters of roofing in both
settlements have been repaired, 141 thousand square
meters. Of the 25.5 thousand square meters of
window blocks, 23.8 thousand were replaced. In
Shebekino, residents came up with questions. I
saw the legitimacy of the appeals, including within
the framework of the live broadcast ‚Äú10 questions
for the governor‚Äù, ‚Äã‚Äãpeople write comments, the
circuit has been restored. For example, in cases,
the report of the head of the district, the order,
it turned out that the double-glazed window was
broken and required replacement. So, of course,
change it. Our main task is to give residents
the opportunity to return home. I stopped by house
number 12 Parkovaya Street. Here, the work of
covering the roof with profiled sheets, filing
the overhangs, installing a drainage system, insulating
the screed of the attic space, and installing
the filling of the openings - plastic windows
for the stained-glass windows of the loggias -
have been completed. Currently, work is underway
to seal interpanel seams, paint the facade, screed
the floors of 4-5 floors, and commissioning of
the heating system is being carried out. In house
No. 3 Parkovaya Street, work was completed on
the installation of internal external walls, floor
slabs on floors 2, 3, 4, floor formwork on the
5th floor, interior partitions were installed
on 2-3 entrances, internal external wall panels
were dismantled, floor slabs on floors 2-5, floor
5 was poured floors. Finishing work in the apartments
is now underway. Special thanks to the director
of the St. Petersburg Tractor Plant, Sergei Aleksandrovich
Serebryakov. He presented the district administration
with a front-end loader ‚ÄúKirovets K-708PK7‚Äù, which
will help restore housing and will be useful for
performing municipal work. In Novaya Tavolzhanka,
he inspected the facilities earlier. The main
problem is related to the operational situation.
Restoration work will begin in full force on the
streets. We hope that the situation will change
for the better and allow us to catch up with the
lost volume of work.

Text: Information about the strikes inflicted by the
Armed Forces of Ukraine on the region over the
past 24 hours:‚†ÄüìçIn Belgorod, three people were
previously killed as a result of falling UAV debris:
a man, a woman and a small child. Two more are
in serious condition - a man with burns to the
respiratory tract, a woman with a fracture of
the lower extremity and a concussion of the upper
and lower extremities. Doctors provide the necessary
assistance. As a result of falling debris, a private
house was completely destroyed, two were partially
damaged. Three cars were also damaged. The causes
of the incident have been established through
investigative measures.‚†ÄüìçIn the Belgorod region,
3 artillery and 3 mortar shells were fired into
the village of Nekhoteevka, 3 mortar shells were
fired into the village of Krasny Khutor, and an
artillery shell was fired into the village of
Naumovka. A UAV dropped fragmentation ammunition
in Krasny Khutor. The enemy also attacked with
the help of kamikaze drones - the drone hit the
villages of Solntsevka, Naumovka, Krasny Khutor.
There is no damage to any settlements in the area.‚†ÄüìçIn
the Borisov district, on the outskirts of the
village of Tsapovka, a quadcopter dropped two
explosive devices, and an attack was carried out
using two kamikaze drones. There were no consequences.‚†ÄüìçIn
the Valuysky urban district, the village of Novopetrovka,
a kamikaze drone fell with subsequent detonation.
There were no casualties. In two private households,
windows were broken, fence facades were damaged.‚†ÄüìçIn
the Volokonovsky district, a mortar grenade launcher
fired at the outskirts of the Stary farm - 6 grenade
launcher shots and a mortar shell were recorded.
A mortar shell was fired on the outskirts of the
village of Tishanka. There are no damages to any
settlements affected.‚†ÄüìçIn the Grayvoronsky urban
district, mortar shelling hit the outskirts of
the village of Poroz - 4 arrivals were detected.
No one was hurt, there was no damage. 20 mortar
shells were fired at the outskirts and center
of the village of Dronovka. There were no casualties.
As a result of the shelling, a private house and
outbuildings caught fire, a gas pipeline, a tractor
and two cars were damaged by shrapnel. At the
moment the fire was extinguished, gas supply was
restored.‚†ÄüìçIn the Krasnoyaruzhsky district, artillery
shelled the outskirts of the village of Grafovka
- 9 arrivals were recorded. No one was hurt. As
a result of the shelling, a power line was damaged.
The power line has now been restored. 7 artillery
shells were fired at the village of Vyazovoe,
and two kamikaze drones detonated in the village
of Staroselye. There were no consequences in populated
areas.‚†ÄüìçIn the Shebekinsky urban district, the
villages of Novaya Tavolzhanka, Murom UAV dropped
2 8 fragmentation munitions, respectively. 4 artillery
shells were fired at the village of Rzhevka, 3
grenade launcher shots were fired at the village
of Pankov. The Shebekino checkpoint was attacked
by a kamikaze drone. There were no damage to any
settlements in the district.

will be a good help for the export of such products.

two-day program of negotiation meetings, it becomes
obvious that Russia is consistently successfully

relations. And in two days, we will undoubtedly

Text: Gazprom and Novatek, through the mediation of
Vladimir Putin, found a solution to the construction
of the Volkhov - Murmansk - Belokamenka gas pipeline,
the necessary Murmansk LNG project: Novatek will
build the facility with its own money, sell it
to Gazprom in installments to pay for gas transit.
In addition, the capacity of the gas pipeline
will be increased to 30‚Äì40 billion cubic meters.
year of ensuring gasification of the Murmansk
region of Karelia. The project initially has two
problems: taking 400 billion rubles for implementation,
the issue of export rights, Gazprom has a monopoly
on the ownership of main gas pipelines. The compromise
that has been found resolves the issues, allowing
the country to speed up an important project for
Novatek, which is necessary to increase gas exports,
undermined by the Nord Stream explosions. At the
same time, the issue of gasification of the northern
regions of the country is being resolved, which
will have a positive effect on the ecology of
the North and will give impetus to the development
of local industry. As for Gazprom, it is concentrating
on the large-scale construction of gas pipelines
in the eastern part of the country. Note that
the compromise reached with the participation
of the president is possible with the partnership
between business and government, which has been
built over the past decades. And the speed, the
solution has been found - the project was announced
in May, they want to start construction in 2024
- shows that the state is paying attention to
projects designed to ensure the growth of the
Russian economy under conditions of external pressure.

Text: Bosnian diary, continued. SERBIAN ‚ÄúATTACK‚Äù So,
on November 1, 1992, we arrived in the city of
Visegrad. The sounds of gunfire came to the city
- Serbian artillery was firing at Muslim positions
located a kilometer away from the city. In the
evening we received machine guns (an unimportant
copy of a Kalashnikov) and went to a dinner hosted
by the command of the honor brigade. We must give
the Serbs their due - neither then nor did they
skimp on the treat. On November 14, they first
became acquainted with the ‚ÄúSerbian method‚Äù of
attack. A group of twenty fighters (including
three Russians) approached the village of Zakrsnica.
Six Muslims were found. From a distance of three
hundred meters, three machine guns, a grenade
launcher, and small arms opened fire on the village.
Two ‚ÄúMuslims‚Äù were killed (one was taken down
by Ace sniper). The enemy fighters quickly responded
to the houses with machine gun fire. They stopped
firing and destroyed the houses with four grenade
launcher shots. The Serbs had losses. But after
going down the mountains to take the village,
the Serbs (very happy) went back. Andrei Nimenko
died, who, expecting a Serbian attack, went down
to the very houses, intending to throw grenades.
Zakrsnica was a ‚Äústumbling block‚Äù for the Serbs.
The Muslims maintained a small, tenacious garrison.
They, despite constant mortar shelling (Visegrad
two kilometers away, up the mountain), managed
to graze a large herd of cows in the valley. The
Serbs made ‚Äúattacks‚Äù five more times. There was
a case when As Andrey entered the village, threw
grenades and shot two houses with a grenade launcher,
but, supported by the Serbs, they were forced
to retreat. Another time, having descended the
morning fog of the mountain, a group of Russians
let out the windows of the house, voices were
heard, two disposable ‚ÄúZols‚Äù. All the Serbs lost
a single person in Zakrsnica. And the Muslims
left, and the herd was ‚Äúcovered‚Äù by mortar fire.
In the photo: Soldiers of the 1st Russian Volunteer
Detachment. Bosnia, 1992

Text: What is Israel's ground operation in the Gaza
Strip: analysis of the Military Chronicle. Part
1 If the Israeli leadership decides on a ground
operation, the IDF will have to choose a bad bad
scenario. Will there be a ground operation? Large-scale
ground operation - possible scenarios, fact, he
was chosen. Perhaps the Israeli leadership will
choose the radical option of establishing a complete
blockade of the enclave through private operations
to destroy identified Hamas militants and release
hostages. Why is a ground operation needed? It
requires physical control of the territory of
the Palestinian enclave; it is impossible to destroy
the manpower of the infrastructure of the Hamas
movement. It is impossible to carry out the tasks
of the presence of ground forces ‚Äúon the ground‚Äù.
But deciding on a large-scale ground operation
is not easy for a number of reasons. Which ones?
Firstly, Israel will have to fight a super-urbanized
area of ‚Äã‚Äã365 square meters. km, 2 million people
live in dense urban areas. Such an environment
minimizes the advantages of IDF intelligence,
aviation and heavy equipment. Secondly, a series
of airstrikes by the Israeli Air Force in Gaza,
a significant number of residents are ready to
join the ranks of Hamas. In fact, Islamists sit
in a huge motivated mobilization reserve. According
to various estimates, 250 thousand 600 thousand
Palestinians of different ages will take weapons
from Gaza. Thirdly, the IDF forces, despite the
concentration of forces, faced active opposition
from armed groups. Apparently, the mobilization
of 320 thousand people was required by Israel
to respond to possible attempts at external intervention,
taking into account the potential involvement
of the conflict by Hezbollah, the IRGC, Muslim
volunteers from neighboring countries - Jordan,
Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Syria and Iraq. In the event
of the arrival of additional troops, the weapons
of the countries fighting on the Palestinian side
will have enough of the current level of mobilization
for Israel. Fourth, the death of high-ranking
officers of the Golani and Nahal ground brigades,
along with personnel, showed that Israel is partially
ready for large-scale urban battles. The training
of reservists of the regular forces is uneven;
the units are ready for active combat operations.
This is evidenced, for example, by repeated cases
of ‚Äúfriendly fire‚Äù by parts of the Israeli security
forces, which have been recorded in recent days.
With time for additional training, there is no
combat coordination of the mobilized Israeli army.
To lead? The ground battle of Gaza is neither
simple nor quick. Everyone understands this, Tel
Aviv. The operation will require Israel to attract
significant resources - human, material and political.
In addition, the ground operation is, in general,
extremely bloody. It is difficult to predict the
level of losses; the experience of the battles
of the US Army Mosul and the Syrian army Aleppo
allows us to assume that we are talking about
tens of thousands of killed and wounded. However,
it should be emphasized that Israel is historically
more sensitive to losses than its opponents. There
is a possibility that a protracted operation combined
with high losses will negatively affect public
political support. A detailed analysis of the
features of the IDF operation in the Gaza Strip
- the second part of the analysis.‚ò†Ô∏è Military
chronicle

Text: ü§ëVladimir Putin introduced the mandatory sale
of foreign exchange earnings for individual exporters.
The President of Russia signed a decree to stabilize
the Russian exchange rate, and the mandatory sale
of foreign exchange earnings for individual exporters
was introduced. Thus, the government plans to
reduce the dollar exchange rate by 80 rubles.
This decree is valid for 6 months. We are talking
about companies operating in the fuel and energy
complex, ferrous non-ferrous metallurgy, chemical
forestry industry, and grain farming. The document
signed by Putin introduces three main innovations.
Thus, individual companies are required to repatriate
and sell foreign exchange earnings within six
months, in a time frame set by the Cabinet of
Ministers. Secondly, the obligation of individual
companies to submit to the Bank of Russia Rosfinmonitoring
indicative plans and schedules for the purchase
and sale of foreign currency on the domestic market
is being introduced. Third, authorized representatives
of Rosfinmonitoring are introduced into individual
companies, the tasks include monitoring and ensuring
compliance with the rules of currency regulation,
the message emphasizes. First Deputy Prime Minister
Andrei Belousov explained that the measures are
aimed at creating long-term conditions that increase
the transparency and predictability of the foreign
exchange market, reducing the possibility of currency
speculation‚≠ï Subscribe NEWS. ru

Text: Another issue raised by Andrei Chibis at the Federation
Council is fuel oil quotas. There are three regions
left in Russia that are heated with expensive
fuel (Murmansk region, Yakutia-Kamchatka). A 3.5-fold
increase in prices makes the regions' costs of
getting through the heating season critical. In
2019, on the instructions of Vladimir Putin, the
lost income of the subjects was compensated by
the federal budget; starting from 2024, state
quotas for the purchase of fuel were used. Oil
traders offered a discount to today's prices,
at the level of 50%, 20 thousand rubles per ton.
At first glance, it‚Äôs not bad, but the check seems
to be tricky. August - early autumn - seasonal
peak season, caused by the preparation of regions
for winter by the closure of foreign contracts
for the cessation of river navigation. The supply
of oil traders is 1.5-2 times higher than the
cost of fuel oil in the spring of the year. According
to the Murmansk governor, he considers a fair
price to be 9.6 thousand rubles per ton, VAT on
delivery (for Yakutia-Kamchatka the price is higher).
Proposals voiced by the Governor of the Federation
Council, a draft Resolution has been submitted,
and the Upper House will seek implementation.
It seems that the regions of the North have a
powerful ally in the person of Valentina Matvienko
in the upper house of parliament. We pay tribute
to the Murmansk governor, said the main Arctic
lobbyist.

Text: 5 years of fasting. Governor of the Kursk Region
Roman Starovoit summed up the interim results
Governor Starovoit decided, together with the
residents, to sum up the interim results of his
5-year term as head of the subject. Judging by
the presented figures, the case of ‚Äúbuilding a
successful region‚Äù in the conditions of the Northern
Military District, proximity to the Ukrainian
border, is of interest to political scientists
of the country‚Äôs top leadership. The combination
of national projects with the author's (regional)
agenda ultimately gave a serious impetus to the
economic development of the region and improved
the quality of life of Kursk residents. In an
hour-long report, the governor touched on two
dozen areas of life - the security of the digitalization
economy. An interesting difference is the emphasis
on the role of the team of the former governor
Alexander Mikhailov in the successes. According
to political scientist Vladimir Slatinov, ‚Äúthe
report is constructed in contrast to the previous
government, the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãcontinuation. This is
a grateful, political gesture addressed to the
former elites.‚Äù Priority: safety. In the conditions
of the Northern Military District, the region‚Äôs
main priority remains ensuring security and restoring
damaged infrastructure. In the Kursk region there
is a voluntary people's squad, courses have been
organized on the management of unmanned aerial
vehicles, the basics of tactical medicine, and
combat tactics. Economic growth. The region's
budget in 2023 will grow to 135.5 billion rubles
(twice as much as in 2018). For five years, the
gross regional product has grown 2 times the expected
2023 796.5 billion rubles, industry - 1.6 times
550.7 billion rubles. (manufacturing industries
- doubled), agriculture - 1.8 times 257.9 billion
rubles, construction - 2.6 times 147.6 billion
rubles. Attracting investments. Over 5 years,
the regional economy attracted about 890.5 billion
rubles. investments (until 2030, investments are
expected to grow by 2.115 trillion rubles). A
significant volume is provided by large companies
operating in the region: Kursk NPP, Mikhailovsky
GOK, Miratorg, Agropromkomplektatsiya, Sodruzhestvo
companies. Healthcare. Modernization of the system
(renovation of clinics, construction of an oncology
center) and successful experience in the fight
against coronavirus have yielded results: life
expectancy has increased in the Kursk region.
Transport reform. Thanks to a large-scale reform
(which Starovoit personally oversees), Kursk is
creating the best public transport system in the
country. We are talking about a serious update
of the rolling stock, modernization of the system.
The eternal Russian problem of roads in the region
is being solved by allocating 1 billion rubles.
road repairs in areas (‚Äúgovernor's billion‚Äù).
Active construction. In the region, the problem
of defrauded shareholders has been eradicated,
and the volume of construction of housing (600
thousand sq. m. in 2023) and industrial commercial
facilities (138 thousand sq. m.) has been significantly
increased. In addition, new schools and kindergartens
are being built in the region.@kstati_p

Text: Yesterday, federal senators were talking about
the Far East - the government hour of the Federation
Council was dedicated to the speech of the plenipotentiary
representative of the President of the Far Eastern
Federal District Yuri Trutnev. He spoke about
the development of the macroregion, summing up
what had been done and outlining the prospects.
Senators discussed the speech with enthusiasm
- not surprisingly, the Far East is on the agenda
for the coming years. After all, the ‚Äúturn to
the East‚Äù of the Russian economy in international
politics triggered a change in the global vector
of ‚Äúdominion‚Äù of Western countries. The general
opinion of the Chamber of Regions was expressed
in the final speech by the Chairman of the Federation
Council Valentina Matvienko: ‚ÄúIn recent years,
the leadership of Yuri Petrovich and the Ministry
of Eastern Development have done, colleagues,
to attract investment and create new jobs. It
is important that colleagues work creatively,
new tools appear to support development, new ideas,
new proposals are being implemented step by step.
But, of course, we want it to develop faster,
more powerfully, more effectively. And the main
problem, in my opinion, is that the vast territory
of the Far East cannot be qualitatively developed,
developed, or landscaped with a sufficient population.
This is perhaps the main constraint today on the
accelerated development of the Far East. The Far
Eastern Federal District is the leader in the
outflow of population from the federal districts
of Russia... This, colleagues, is an alarming
signal, the risks of the outflow of the population
of the Far East remain high... Look, do it, people
are happy with the fact that they live in the
Far East - good salary, good place to work , most
importantly, they feel more comfortable in everyday
life, better in the regions of Russia. And it
seems that the more important task is to preserve
the population, to live in the territory, to think,
to attract people... But it made me happy? Yuri
Petrovich said that young people are coming to
the Far East now. It is important. This is good.
Here are young people who are easy to rise to.
If they gain a foothold, then there is prospects
for development. Yuri Petrovich, I would like
to wish you success. The attention to the Far
East is enormous. The right course has been taken,
it‚Äôs done, we‚Äôre waiting, the flywheel is spinning
faster, the population of the Far East is growing,
including migration factors, and an increase in
the birth rate. A wonderful region. There are
traditions - to develop them.‚Äù In general, to
summarize, there are results, there is enough
work. The main priority is people. From the side,
the Chamber of Regions will support everything
that will help make the life and work of the Far
Easterners - the ‚Äúindigenous‚Äù, those who are ready

Text: Why is Siberia jealous of the Far East? The speech
of the plenipotentiary representative of the President
of the Far Eastern Federal District Yuri Trutnev
to the Federation Council of the Russian Federation
showed how much attention is focused on the development
of the Far East - judging by the violent reaction
of the senators. Many asked questions; the speakers
thanked the plenipotentiary's team for their work,
which is of paramount importance to Russia in
the current international situation. Here are
the words of the senators, at the same time 3
types of reactions: ‚ÄúDear Yuri Petrovich, sincere
thanks to the people of Sakhalin for your contribution,
the contribution of your team, the initiative
projects that have started working in the Far
East, you listed, are working effectively. It
is therefore important to invest in transport
infrastructure, the Sakhalin region is the only
island region of the Russian Federation, - Andrei
Khapochkin, a representative of Sakhalin, addressed
the plenipotentiary representative. Using the
quote as an example, we see the reaction of the
Far Eastern senators - gratitude was added with
a request to consider, expedite, include and draw
attention to important points in the region. ‚ÄúDear
Yuri Petrovich! I am sure that I will prove to
the audience how important it is for the economy
to develop the mineral resource base and the regions
of the Far East of the Arctic. One of the tools
is the introduction of the junior geological exploration
movement. But to increase the attractiveness of
junior business, noted the senator of the Moscow
region. As we see, our Far Eastern colleagues,
‚ÄúEuropean‚Äù senators, see prospects for the development
of the macroregion and strive to find the interests
of the residents. "At the site of the Eastern
Economic Forum, section meetings were held and
issues of the development of the Far Eastern regions,
Siberia were considered. The proposal, the request
of the Siberian regions - analogies to the Far
East suggests a number of serious measures - "Siberian
mortgage", "Siberian hectare", economic social
measures, brought results, said Deputy Prime Minister,‚Äù
Tomsk Senator Vladimir Kravchenko noted with some
white envy. And the point on the list of opinions
is that studying the Far East, developing regions,
following the beaten path is much easier, more
economical and more effective!
